meanings.definition: A group of students meeting regularly to study a subject together.
meanings.sent1: In our school, the math classes are held in the morning.
meanings.sent2: She signed up for art classes at the community center.
meanings.sent3: The history class was so fun that the students didn't want to leave.
meanings.sent4: The chemistry class was like a magical potion-making session.
meanings.sent5: The music class resonated with beautiful melodies.

meanings.definition: A set or category of things having some property or attribute in common.
meanings.sent1: The different classes of animals include mammals, birds, and reptiles.
meanings.sent2: The store offers various classes of products, from electronics to clothing.
meanings.sent3: The classes of flowers in the garden seemed to have their own little community.
meanings.sent4: The classes of cars on the road moved like colorful blocks.
meanings.sent5: The classes of clouds in the sky painted a breathtaking picture.

meanings.definition: A social stratum sharing basic economic, political, or cultural characteristics.
meanings.sent1: The upper class in society often has access to exclusive privileges.
meanings.sent2: The working class plays a vital role in the economy.
meanings.sent3: The middle class picnic turned into a friendly competition.
meanings.sent4: The artist belonged to a class of creatives who pushed boundaries.
meanings.sent5: The class of musicians performed with passion and skill.
